description.narrative:
Within this project, Fair Finance alliance formed by Oxfam and its partners in Vietnam will adopt Fair Finance Guide to assess investment policies of Vietnamese banks and foreign banks which invest in coal power industry and conduct in-depth research to assess the commitment and environmental behaviour of some selected commercial banks
The assessment will be used to increase community pressure on banks to account for environmental responsibility and to inform financial and banking policies, especiallyregarding the Government#s environmentally and socially sustainable investments. As the Government of Vietnam is reforming the banking sector, there will be many opportunities for social organizations to participate both with the banking sector and policymakers for the purpose of promoting sustainable development. This participation is very important in the country and also has regional significance that the FFA project can contribute.
In Vietnam, there is an increase in the trend of depositing moneyand conducting financial transactions through banks. However, most people and businesses still only consider banks as a tool to control the spending of individuals and organizations, not the social and environmental indicators of banks. In the first 2 yearsof the project to promote fair finance in Vietnam, the project's communication objectives are: (i) raise people#s awareness <(>&<)> promote understanding of the concept of "fair finance" , and (ii) promoting community interest and understanding of the bank's financial justice index of its choice, using this community's interest to increase pressure on banks to be responsible for their school and society. The target of communication activities: (i) working age middle class in cities (22-60 years old), (ii) smalland medium-sized business owners and (iii) ) journalists in the field of economics - finance. The communication message is: "Choose a responsible bank" or "Use money with responsibility".
The project is aiming at below expected results: - Target groups start finding out and show their interests in fair finance concept - Target groups look for fair finance indicators of banks they are using - Information about fair finance indicators is covered more on mass media (newspaper, radio, etc); research reports, case study of published projects on local newspaper

participating-org.narrative: CENTER OF HANDS-ON ACTIONS AND NETW FOR GROWTH AND ENVIRONMENT

Officially founded in 2013 by the first Vietnamese to set foot on Antarctica, CHANGE is an incredibly active environmental non-profit organization based in Ho Chi Minh City. CHANGE promotes and encourages the care and preservation of the environment through education and innovative communications that change habits and inspire community action in Vietnam. CHANGE focuses on three areas: - Fighting environmental degradation and climate change, - Reducing illegal wildlife demands, and - Promoting sustainability.
Vision: A green and clean Vietnam protected by all the people Mission: To promote and encourage the care and preservation of the environment through education and innovative communications that change habits and inspire community action in Vietnam.
